thread.title: PALM SPRINGS: 5 things to do at Modernism Week Fall Preview
thread.title_full: PALM SPRINGS: 5 things to do at Modernism Week Fall Preview - Press Enterprise

author: VANESSA FRANKO
title: PALM SPRINGS: 5 things to do at Modernism Week Fall Preview
text:
BY VANESSA FRANKO / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 2, 2015 Updated: 11:02 p.m. PALM SPRINGS: 5 things to do at Modernism Week Fall Preview 1 of 9 More Related article » If you go What: Modernism Week's Fall Preview
When: Friday through Oct. 12
Information: modernismweek.com/october-2015/
From a kitschy bus ride to architectural walking tours that include celebrity homes, Modernism Week’s Fall Preview is the fun and educational cousin to the star-map tourism of Beverly Hills.
The attraction of Palm Springs’ midcentury modern architecture has become as much of an event in the Coachella Valley as the Palm Springs International Film Festival and the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival.
In February, Modernism Week will feature more than 200 events across 11 days. Think of the Fall Preview, which runs Friday through Oct. 12, as an appetizer for the main course. The weekend itself has been so popular that organizers doubled the amount of events this year.
Whether it’s joining historian Charles Phoenix on a double-decker bus or wandering through the heart of Palm Springs, here are five things worth checking out at Modernism Week’s Fall Preview:
1. Join the Rat Pack
Palm Springs was the Rat Pack’s playground, and the weekend is chock-full of events that will let you unleash your inner Dean Martin or honor the Chairman of the Board.
• Rat Pack Playground – Modernist Homes of Vista Las Palmas Historical Walking Tour takes guests on an exterior tour of the midcentury tract neighborhood where Barry Manilow and Kim Novak had homes as well as Rat Packers Dean Martin and Peter Lawford.
9-11 a.m. Friday through Oct. 12, $35.
• Frank Sinatra’s Neighborhood – The Movie Colony Historical Walking Tour looks at the exteriors of homes in a neighborhood that housed some of Hollywood’s biggest stars, including Cary Grant, Dinah Shore and Gloria Swanson.
9-11:30 a.m. Friday through Oct. 12, $35.
• Frank Sinatra’s Twin Palms Estate Tour gives fans of the Chairman of the Board a peek at the E. Stewart Williams-designed home.
1-1:45 p.m., 1:45-2:30 p.m., 2:30-3:15 p.m., 3:15-4 p.m. Oct. 11. $40.
2. Get on the bus
Have a colorful time with kitschy historian Charles Phoenix as he leads a double-decker bus tour on a 21/2-hour tour that gives guests a chance to see some of the most famous homes without hedges getting in the way.
8:30 a.m. Friday through Oct. 11, $99.
